select1.label: explain purpose and procedure to patient
Locate the affected lung with the help of X-rays, auscultation and percussion
Give steam inhalation to the patient after obtaining doctors written order

Position the patient according to lung segment to be drained Upper Lobes -Uppermost segments – Place the patient in high Fowlers position in the bed -Anterior segments – Place the patient in Semi Fowlers position in a chair or bed (about 300 angle) -Posterior segments – Place the patient in Fowlers position in a chair or bed, provide a cardiac table, so that the patient can lean forward and be supported at 300 angle -Lateral segments – Place the patient in lateral position elevated to about 450, first to one side and then to other side. When out of bed, ask the patient to lean on one arm, resting on chair or table for support -Right middle lobe -Anterior segment (Right side) – Place the patient on left side with a pillow under chest. Right shoulder and body are kept forward -Posterior segment – Place the patient in prone position with chest and abdomen elevated -Lower Lobes -Anterior segments – Place the patient in supine Trendelenburg position with hips elevated with pillows, so that they are higher than shoulders -Posterior segments – Place the patient in prone trendelenburg position with hips elevated with pillows, so that they are higher than shoulders -Lateral segments – Place the patient on right side Trendelenburg position for left lung and left side Trendelenburg position for right lung or with hips elevated with pillows to keep them higher than shoulders
Perform chest percussions and vibrations on the area to be drained
Encourage the patient to cough out secretions and collect in sputum container
Do suctioning (oropharynx/nasopharynx) if coughing is not possible
Make the patient comfortable and ask him/her to rest flat for ten to fifteen minutes before allowing to sit or get out of bed
Dispose the sputum container in infectious waste container. Replace the articles
Document the time, amount, colour of the sputum drained and the response of the patient to therapy.
